title: Kalman Filter Explained Simply
dot:
digraph KalmanFilter{graph[rankdir=TB, splines=true, nodesep=0.5, ranksep=1.0]node[shape=rect, style=filled, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12, fillcolor="#f4f4f9", fontcolor="#333"]start[label="Start
(Measurements received)", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#88C0D0"]init_state[label="Initialize State Estimate
(Position from 1st measurement)", shape=box, fillcolor="#A3BE8C"]reinit_state[label="Reinitialize State Estimate
(Use 2nd position measurement for velocity)", shape=box, fillcolor="#A3BE8C"]predict_state[label="Predict System State
(Using state transition matrix A)", shape=box, fillcolor="#D08770"]kalman_gain[label="Compute Kalman Gain
(Weights the update from the measurement)", shape=box, fillcolor="#EBCB8B"]estimate_state[label="Estimate State
(Using Kalman Gain)", shape=box, fillcolor="#8FBCBB"]end[label="End
(State Estimated: Position, Velocity)", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#88C0D0"]start->init_state[label="First measurement"]init_state->reinit_state[label="Velocity estimate requires 2nd measurement"]reinit_state->predict_state[label="Model prediction (A matrix)"]predict_state->kalman_gain[label="Measurement update"]kalman_gain->estimate_state[label="State and covariance update"]estimate_state->end[label="Output Estimate (Position, Velocity)"]system_model[label="System Model
(State transition, H, Q, R matrices)", shape=plaintext, fontcolor="#5e81ac"]kalman_gain_calc[label="Kalman Gain Formula
K = P*H' * (H*P*H' + R)^-1", shape=plaintext, fontcolor="#5e81ac"] system_model->predict_state[style=dotted]kalman_gain_calc->kalman_gain[style=dotted]subgraph cluster_kalman{label="Kalman Filter Process";color="#2E3440";fontcolor="#eceff4";init_state->reinit_state->predict_state->kalman_gain->estimate_state;}}
